Sentece: We did find, however, that young dogs had nearly twice the ouabain volumes of distribution per kilogram of body weight as adults (155.4 +/- 1.2 (SE) ml/kg vs. 80 +/- 0.6, P less than 0.0005) and that one could account for this difference with the fact that young dogs had nearly twice the plasma volume 108 +/- 9.8, vs. 68 +/- 7.3, P = 0.001) and interstitial fluid space (318 +/- 35 vs. 190 +/- 6.5, P = 0.006) as the adults.
Title: Age-related changes in ouabain pharmacology. Ouabain exhibits a different volume of distribution in adult and young dogs.
